exceptions.tactic: intros m l Hpm Hpl Heq.
intros m' l Hpm Hpl Heq.
intros m' l' Hpm Hpl Heq.

ctx: assert (Hdecomp_m : {lm : list nat | lprod m = lprod lm /\ Forall prime lm}).
assert (Hdecomp_m : {lm : list nat | lprod m = lprod lm /\ Forall prime lm}).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: list nat
l: list nat

Goal:
Forall prime l -> Forall prime m -> lprod l = lprod m -> l ~p m

Premises:
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Notation lprod := (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1)
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, q <d p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
lprod_ge_1 : forall l : list nat, Forall prime l -> 1 <= lprod l
prime_in_decomp : forall (p : nat) (l : list nat), prime p -> Forall prime l -> p <d lprod l -> In p l
lprod_app : forall l m : list nat, lprod (l ++ m) = lprod l * lprod m
prime_decomp : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = lprod l /\ Forall prime l}
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
List.Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l
NoDup_Permutation_bis : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), NoDup l -> length l' <= length l -> incl l l' -> l ~p l'
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
ForallOrdPairs_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
ForallOrdPairs_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
list_discrim : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {Q x}) -> forall l : list X, {lP : list X & {lQ : list X | l ~p lP ++ lQ /\ Forall P lP /\ Forall Q lQ}}
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
nat_list_insert_Forall : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (x : nat) (l : list nat), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (nat_list_insert x l)
List.Forall_rev : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall P (rev l)
Forall_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : list A -> Type), Q nil -> (forall (b : A) (l : list A), P b -> Q (b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Q l
nat_bijection_Permutation : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> FinFun.Injective f -> let l := seq 0 n in map f l ~p l
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
FOP_cons : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> ForallOrdPairs R (a :: l)
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
Forall_inv_tail : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> Forall P l
perm_skip : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l'

```coq
intros m l Hpm Hpl Heq.
assert (Hlprod_m : 1 <= lprod m).
{ apply lprod_ge_1. auto. }
assert (Hlprod_l : 1 <= lprod l).
{ apply lprod_ge_1. auto. }
assert (Hdecomp_m : {lm : list nat | lprod m = lprod lm /\ Forall prime lm}).
{ apply prime_decomp. intro H. rewrite H in Heq. discriminate. }
assert (Hdecomp_l : {ll : list nat | lprod l = lprod ll /\ Forall prime ll}).
{ apply prime_decomp. intro H. rewrite H in Heq. discriminate. }
destruct Hdecomp_m as [lm Hm].
destruct Hdecomp_l as [ll Hl].
assert (Hperm : lm ~p ll).
{ apply Permutation_ind.
  - intro. reflexivity.
  - intros x l l' Hperm_l Hperm_r.
    rewrite <- Hperm_l. rewrite <- Hperm_r. reflexivity.
  - intros x y l. rewrite perm_swap. reflexivity.
  - intros l l' l'' Hperm_l Hperm_r Hperm_l' Hperm_r'.
    transitivity l'; auto.
}
apply Hperm.
Qed.

original: intros m l Hpm Hpl Heq. assert (Hlprod_m : 1 <= lprod m). { apply lprod_ge_1. auto. } assert (Hlprod_l : 1 <= lprod l). { apply lprod_ge_1. auto. } assert (Hdecomp_m : {lm : list nat | lprod m = lprod lm /\ Forall prime lm}). { apply prime_decomp. intro H. rewrite H in Heq. discriminate. } assert (Hdecomp_l : {ll : list nat | lprod l = lprod ll /\ Forall prime ll}). { apply prime_decomp. intro H. rewrite H in Heq. discriminate. } destruct Hdecomp_m as [lm Hm]. destruct Hdecomp_l as [ll Hl]. assert (Hperm : lm ~p ll). { apply Permutation_ind. - intro. reflexivity. - intros x l l' Hperm_l Hperm_r. rewrite <- Hperm_l. rewrite <- Hperm_r. reflexivity. - intros x y l. rewrite perm_swap. reflexivity. - intros l l' l'' Hperm_l Hperm_r Hperm_l' Hperm_r'. transitivity l'; auto. } apply Hperm.
